reviewText: this dvd was very helpful in the skinning and fleshing of many different types of furbearers. The only thing that was missing was the finer point of really cleaning the fur up for marketing and the proper way of sewing up damaged fur. Other than these points the dvd was very good

As a fox and raccoon hunter , I learned a lot of things watching this DVD . How to keep the fur the nicest possible ? A skilful man answers to this question with different furry animals . Only one regret for my wife and me : What can we do to have coats made with such beautiful furs ?
As expected, quick turnaround and good product!
Very useful information for anyone wanting to start saving furs.
poor quality video, the editor should be embarrassed. also claims to be 5 hours long but it's not even close.
Clearly written...good stuff. Just what I was looking for. It's good information, even if you don't plan on putting up fur
This video had some good info in it.  It had been a while since I had skinned anything, so I thought I would pick this up and check it out.  It was put together very well.  Good information!

My husband loves hunting and wants to start doing his own taxodermy.  He has watched this video several times.  The first video I got was scratched and the inside of the holder was broke.  Amazon sent a new one right away!

i found this video very informative and extremely useful. it is totally hands on and detailed enough to get the job done.

i have watched this video numerous times in preparation for my first trapping season. my first catches were 4 raccoons and a red fox. i was able to skin them out in good time and the pelts came out better as i moved along.

i haven't got the chance to trap any coyotes yet but i have confidence in the skinning process due to this video.

the video segments are layed out very well and easy to navigate to each animal you are attempting to skin out. after skinning, stretcher sizes are suggested for each.

if you are a beginner, i feel this video is a must have. highly recommend

No rabbits or squirrels in this one.
I would have given 5 stars for at least one way to skin a cat.
